1:
The wise woman builds her house,\q but a foolish woman tears it down with her own hands.
\q
2:
The one who walks uprightly fears Yahweh,\q but the one who is dishonest in his ways despises him.


\q
3:
From the mouth of a fool comes an offshoot of his pride,\q but the lips of the wise will preserve them.
\q
4:
Where there are no cattle the feeding trough is clean,\q but an abundant crop can come by the strength of an ox.


\q
5:
A faithful witness does not lie,\q but a false witness breathes out lies.
\q
6:
A mocker seeks wisdom and there is none,\q but knowledge comes easy to the one who is discerning.

\q
7:
Walk away from a foolish person,\q for you will not find knowledge on his lips.
\q
8:
The wisdom of the prudent person is to understand his own way,\q but the folly of fools is deception.


\q
9:
Fools mock when the guilt offering is sacrificed,\q but among the upright favor is shared.
\q
10:
The heart knows its own bitterness\q and no stranger shares its joy.

\q
11:
The house of wicked people will be destroyed,\q but the tent of upright people will flourish.
\q
12:
There is a way that seems right to a man,\q but its end only leads to death.


\q
13:
A heart can laugh but still be in pain\q and joy may end up being grief.
\q
14:
The one who is not faithful will get what his ways deserve,\q but a good person will get what is his.


\q
15:
The one who is naive believes everything,\q but the prudent man thinks about his steps.
\q
16:
A wise man fears and turns away from evil,\q but the fool confidently dismisses a warning.


\q
17:
One who is quick to become angry does foolish things,\q and a person who makes evil schemes is hated.
\q
18:
The naive inherit foolishness,\q but prudent people are crowned with knowledge.


\q
19:
Evil people will bow down before those who are good\q and those who are wicked will bow down at the gates of the righteous person.
\q
20:
The poor person is hated even by his own companions,\q but the rich people have many friends.


\q
21:
The one who shows contempt for his neighbor is sinning,\q but the one who shows favor to the poor is blessed.
\q
22:
Do not those who plot evil go astray?\q But those who plan to do good will receive covenant faithfulness and trustworthiness.


\q
23:
With all hard work comes a profit,\q but when there is only talk, it leads to poverty.
\q
24:
The crown of wise people is their wealth,\q but the folly of fools brings them only more folly.


\q
25:
A truthful witness saves lives,\q but a false witness breathes out lies.


\q
26:
When someone fears Yahweh, he also has much confidence in him;\q these things will be like a strong place of protection for this man's children.
\q
27:
The fear of Yahweh is a fountain of life,\q so that a person may turn away from the snares of death.


\q
28:
The glory of a king is found in the great number of his people,\q but without people the prince is ruined.
\q
29: A patient person has great understanding,\q but the quick-tempered person exalts folly.
30:
A tranquil heart is life for the body,\q but envy rots the bones.
\q
31:
The one who oppresses the poor curses his Maker,\q but the one who shows favor to the needy honors him.


\q
32:
The wicked person is brought down by his evil actions,\q but the righteous person has a refuge even in death.
\q
33:
Wisdom rests in the heart of the discerning,\q but even among fools she lets herself be known.


\q
34:
Doing what is right exalts a nation,\q but sin is a disgrace to any people.
\q
35: The favor of the king is with the servant who acts prudently,\q but his anger is for the one who acts shamefully.
